script.content: Welcome class! Today we will explore our Solar System. We will start with the Sun, the center of our system, and then visit each planet in order.
The Sun is a massive star at the center of our solar system. It provides the light and heat that makes life possible on Earth.

script.intro: Let's observe a solar flare in action.
script.outro: As you can see, the sun is incredibly active and powerful.

script.content: Next, we have Mercury, the closest planet to the Sun. It is small and rocky.
Welcome class! Today we explore Gravity. It is the force that pulls everything towards the center of the Earth.

script.intro: Let's watch this apple fall to understand acceleration.
script.outro: As we saw, the apple accelerates as it falls due to gravity.

script.content: This brings us to Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation, which describes this force mathematically.
Greetings! I am Edura. Let's travel back in time to Ancient Rome. Rome started as a small village on the Tiber River.
It grew into a massive empire that controlled the entire Mediterranean basin.

script.intro: Let's look at a map of the Roman Empire at its peak.
script.outro: Notice how vast their territory was, stretching from England to Egypt.
